storyInfo: After overcoming the fear in the depths of her heart, Reed successfully controls her Originium Arts to heal her comrade. As Eblana sounds the bugle to war, Reed expresses her ideals to her companions.

attributes.content: She'd considered the possibility of ending it all, even if it meant the fires of the Draco would never die.
She'd imagined the flames of wrath bursting from her aching chest, burning away the shell and identity she had been given, liberating her from the shackles of her self.
But when she truly went to touch her flames, desiring to hold them, she suddenly wondered if she never had control over them in the first place.
You've done well, Loughshinny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You wanted me to give you my sincere praise. Is this good enough?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Or have you prepared yourself by now... for the shadow to return to the self, for you to replace me as 'The Leader'?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I can give you this opportunity. Your next plume of flames will burn me to ashes.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Will you... reach out to me?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The flames burn, and her shadow sways slightly.
But Reed averts her eyes.
Not far away, Caireann, who has just woken up, slowly props herself up atop an old apron, and Moran hums as she helps clean her wound.
Sister, why did you come back?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What do you see, as you stand here?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The campfire burned bright that night.
At the time, Fionn was wandering around begging for a new foothold to get business up and running, and Selmon was wrapping more wire around her weapon.
Everyone called her the Leader jokingly, but they were serious when they thanked her for bringing them all here.
I heard that King Gaeil was crowned by the Victorians, and only then did they erect the royal palace over a ceremonial stone circle.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Before that... it was first home to the Tarans.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She thinks back to festive winter nights from long, long ago.
They would change into new, matching outfits in front of the fireplace, leaving behind a photograph of their smiling faces.
What a lovely... warm little ball of flame.
So... no.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I don't care about being a shadow.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But I am not your shadow. I am simply—the shadow of our people's ideal 'Leader.'
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They want a way out, a way to get their lives back; I happened to be there, and became needed by them.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: So why must I defeat you, Sister?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Not afraid of death? Please don't say that, Caireann. There's nothing wrong with being afraid of dying.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: How tragic would it be to die at Dublinn's hands before we save our fellow Tarans? Dublinn wants to save them too, you know.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You're... a lot more well-spoken than before.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee
Taran Refugee
attributes.content: Lucky we've still got plenty of anti-inflammatories...

attributes.name: Taran Refugee
attributes.content: Ufff...
Did that hurt? Sorry...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Ah, Reed, you're back.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: If we hide here tonight, we shouldn't run into any of the Arts-controlled corpses again.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Have you surveyed around us already? That's good.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I wish we could stop a bit longer myself, but Caireann's injuries... aren't looking good.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Hey, what's that look on you for...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Haha. I still remember at the beginning, we all saw you like you were our doctor. Only later we realized you're just like all of us—wounded.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Are my own wounds, well, er, serious?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: No, they aren't... Don't worry. Your injuries can be healed.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's just... are you afraid of my fire?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: And so she reaches out, to the wounded Taran in front of her.
The Draco's burning anger wells within her blood. In bygone times, the Red Dragon bled for his people, one drop of his blood incinerating plains from end to end.
She swallows her roiling breath. The suppressed flames scorch her.
But if doing so can soothe pain, then she is willing to endure it.
—It is no true flame that burns in her hands, not even a flash of light.
But invariably, the people are filled with the same feeling—the flowing of life, as gentle as one's eyes opening for the first time to the rays of morning.
*sigh*...
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I'm guessing by your face... you're already feeling a lot better?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Yeah... Reed, you... maybe you really are a doctor? Still, not that you work the same way other docs do.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee
Reed
attributes.content: No. What these are... are my own flames, at long last.
attributes.joined: Lucky we've still got plenty of anti-inflammatories...Ufff.........No. What these are... are my own flames, at long last.

attributes.content: May you sleep soundly tonight, Caireann.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Never thought I'd see the day someone outside the Victorian Army would board a high-speed battleship.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: That should've been the first thing on your mind the moment you lowered the Victorian flag.
attributes.name: Dublinn Officer

attributes.content: I have nothing against you, Taran—I just want to see your forces' military proficiency. Plus, I'm rather curious about that Leader of yours.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: I certainly hope the Duke's guest isn't just relying on her Draco bloodline.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Your arrogance towards us seeps from your very bones, Victorian.
attributes.name: Dublinn Officer

attributes.content: But when she gets up on stage to give her speech, you'll find that she is the true master of the forces on this ship.
attributes.name: Dublinn Officer

attributes.content: I still don't get it. Are you people Dublinn or not? After all, you don't dress anything like them.
attributes.name: Wounded Taran

attributes.content: But, regardless of who you are, you saved us from the Victorians. I'll follow you anywhere.
attributes.name: Wounded Taran

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry we couldn't—help your friend.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: It's fine... it's fine. As long as others can be saved, I suppose you can say he's still living through them.
attributes.name: Wounded Taran

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: By the way, Reed, have those people given up on hunting us?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Hmm... The team that was tailing us vanished fairly abruptly, but in any case, things work to our advantage.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Dublinn's forces should be assembled now.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...The Tarans are about to make their voice heard throughout Victoria.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Soldiers.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Dublinn forces I am in charge of have come from all over Victoria to join His Lordship's army, and together, they will fire the opening shots to the war for their survival.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Up until the last few days, many people may not have heard of the Dublinn name, or have any idea what we are fighting for.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Your war is picking up steam as we speak, but ours has been raging on and on over the last decade. As we speak, those flying the Taran banner continue to bleed.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: There are no words that can describe the atrocities that the Tarans have had to endure. I have seen their streets burned to ash, their cities reduced to rubble.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And yet they, who deserve everything the land can give them, met with our soldiers at risk of being executed to break their bread with us.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I saw the Tarans crying out to us in their struggles. However, their salvation has been deferred not decades, but entire centuries.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They appeal to their great and mighty compatriots... and to their neighbors of conscience, to all those Victorians who will not be co-conspirators to tyranny.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They cry out for our attentive eyes.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As I speak, there are those among us who are well-aware of their Taran blood. Yet, there are others who may be asking—who exactly are we going to help?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Tarans. Tarans... With all the time we've spent together, we've all gotten used to using this word.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: But what you said never left my mind, Reed. You said the factory workshop we were in lacked protective measures, so everyone would slowly come down with Oripathy and waste away.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Yet, the owner of the factory who drove the Tarans to work under such dangerous conditions... was himself a Taran.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: And there are so many people like you who speak bog-standard Victorian. Though they were born in the same place as us, they're afraid of talking with us, and revealing their accents...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: What exactly is a Taran? Who is it we're trying to save?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: It's been on my mind for a long time, too. Do you want to hear what I think?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Go on, Reed. We're not looking forward that badly to fleeing for our lives. Of course we're happy to hear you out.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Mm... At this point, I might say—it's the name given to the centuries of our plight.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: In the past, Victorians spent many years trying to erase the Taran name. But I'm sure you can all feel it—those ties are still there.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Victorians don't call us Tarans. They call us 'nasty-sounding, uncultured bumpkins, good-for-nothing rascals, ill-bred scum'...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Or, as many people have experienced, they strip us of our property, our land, and our rights... even the lives of our kin. All because of our common name.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Some may say to us—then why not give up your language and your traditions? Why not sing the same songs as Victorians at the festivals?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As long as others can't tell that we're Tarans, we'll be able to receive the same treatment as them.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Of course, there are others who may retort that even though they are Tarans, they've earned wealth through willpower and dedication, receiving enough education to climb up into the upper class.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: —To this I say, how ironic it is that we must throw aside our culture and betray our own name, just to earn the dignity of being seen as ordinary people by them.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Though some of us have achieved greatness, the first step to success invariably is to become Victorian.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Duke Wellington, surely you understand this better than anyone else...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: How many people still remember that your heart pumps a Taran's blood?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But. Given that Victoria is deliberately trying to strip us of our name, does that mean they've really forgotten about Tara's existence?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: If that were the case, then why did I, a descendent of King Gaeil, a surviving Draco, two hundred years after the fall of the Taran kingdom—
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: —Watch my parents be murdered by the Aslans' assassins, left to lie in their own blood?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No. They are afraid that we will remember our names and expose their lies.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And I stand before you to remind you of this fact.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: So what you're saying is, years and years ago, the Victorian nobles came to Tara to subjugate all its people?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Yes. That much is what the history books tell us.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There's numerous fabrications about Tara, but some interspersed truths too.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Victoria forcibly put King Gaeil into power as monarch of the Tara region, coercing him to canonize many Victorian nobles. The unfair treatment towards Tara as a land was codified into law, too.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Since then, the Taran's accent has been associated with their lowly status. The Victorians have come to see the Tarans as stupid, vulgar, and uneducated.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But who will come to educate the people of Tara? In all these hundreds of years, not a single soul.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Tarans have slowly fled from their homeland, perhaps drifting through Victoria along with its nomadic cities, but never enjoying the same rights and privileges as the Victorians.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Have we ever had seats at prestigious banquets or institutions of higher education? If there are layabouts among us, is that not because the Victorians have taken away our right to work?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The injustices we've long endured were so cleverly hidden away in the lengthy years after the word 'Taran' was expunged. But, no longer. We finally understand why we have been driven to despair.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: There is much I know, both about Tara's history, as well as about the legends spun by subsequent generations to trace Tara's origins.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I can tell you about everything—true injustices, and fabricated dreams alike.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But I won't speak of them. You'll all want to... escape from your past lives.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Well, of course! We can't live on like this!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Mm. So, it's alright even if we can't tell we're Tarans.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I just think—wherever the lights-out chimes, everyone must need a flame that burns through the night.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The only thing we must fight is the misfortune thrust upon us.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.text: Therefore, to fight for the Tarans

attributes.content: Right now, we are docked in Oak Grove, once a Taran community burned to ashes by a tyrant's flames.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Perhaps those with keen enough eyesight will be able to see Tara's palace destroyed by a Catastrophe over yonder. Such are the scars left behind on the Taran people.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: However, it is hardly our intent to recover Tara's ancient lands, or reconstruct our history out of its tatters.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: We are wanderers in a new land, and the road I wish to take you down is one of constructing a new era and a new order.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: —This battleship's next stop will be at the port of Londinium.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Naturally, we are not going to compete for Victoria's crown. We simply are taking our destiny back from the Victorians, into our own hands.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Our eyes are open now—we clearly see that our suffering is rooted in the dominion and servitude that Victoria imposed upon Tara. As such, we ought to let Victoria deny the legitimacy of its own past actions.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The war may not end in Londinium, but surely we do not fear a long and bitter fight?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The flames have already been kindled.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: They will burn away the ancient order of this land, taking our rotten shackles along with it.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As for the new order that shall be established, I turn to all of you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I implore all of you, regardless of whether you're Taran or Victorian, regardless of who you are or where you came from, to simply fight for the glory of justice, for the unprecedented era to come.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Until the Tarans are free to compose their own dreams, just as the Victorians are, nothing shall stand in our way.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But, Reed, what are we fighting for? 'For the survival of the Tarans' is simply too vague.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Mm... In past times, I always thought—that life was so fragile.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Upon this great land, many a thing waits to take our lives from us. Everything we do is no more—than a desperate struggle, a stand, against death.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And in the end, one from which nobody can emerge victorious.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: If I concerned myself too much with people's lives, how would I ever be able to come face-to-face—with the all too ubiquitous sacrifices, with the sea of unmarked graves?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yet—the weight of a life... is immense. That is something I can't escape from.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: We cannot defeat death. But we can—and we should—give dignity to the living.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I believe... that the people of Tara should have a warm fire at night, and wine in their glasses when they sing their songs.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There should be a day, when the people of Tara no longer have to run away, or bid farewell to their families and lovers.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I hope—for the people of Tara to have their own homeland, where they can live in peace.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I hope... that all those we've parted ways with—will all be reunited there.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The wind rustles the reeds, and amidst their swishing, she feels the painful sear of the dancing flames.
She sees that it is an austere, yet distant dream. Perhaps, not a single person standing here will be here to see that day come.
...Dublinn's flames will burn this land.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Surely... it will be harrowing. Thousands upon thousands of lives, nothing more than fuel for the flames of war.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But even then, the weight of a life cannot ever be diminished.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Let's go. We are a part of it too.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, right, I got a letter from home yesterday.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: They're all alive and well. Maybe when we get back from war, they'll be doing even better. Haha!
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Lost for words again, Moran?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Sorry. I couldn't help wondering to myself. What should living life be like?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Well, how about starting with a song?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Go on. You might as well—nobody's after our heads for once.
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: By the firelight of homely hearth I sleep, dreaming of honey, rum, and stew ♪
Say, Reed. What are you gonna do if we end up siding with Dublinn?
attributes.name: Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Don't worry.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There's no difference between her and I. We're both trying to realize the same single dream for the Taran people.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: When that day comes, I will go see her.
attributes.name: Reed
